1.text: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I would not have you ignorant.

2.text: Ye know that ye were Gentiles, carried away to these dumb idols, even as ye were led.

3.text: Wherefore I give you to understand, that no man speaking by the Spirit of God, calleth Jesus accursed: and that no man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the Holy Spirit.

4.text: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.

5.text: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.

6.text: And there are diversities of operations, but it is the same God who worketh all in all.

7.text: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man for profit.

8.text: For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to another, the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;

9.text: To another, faith by the same Spirit; to another, the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;

10.text: To another, the working of miracles; to another, prophecy; to another, discerning of spirits; to another, divers kinds of languages; to another, the interpretation of languages:

11.text: But all these worketh that one and the same Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.

12.text: For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so also is Christ.

13.text: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Gentiles, whether bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.

14.text: For the body is not one member, but many.

15.text: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

16.text: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

17.text: If the whole body were an eye, where were the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where were the smelling?

18.text: But now hath God set the members every one of them in the body, as it hath pleased him.

19.text: And if they were all one member, where were the body?

20.text: But now are they many members, yet but one body.

21.text: And the eye cannot say to the hand, I have no need of thee: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

22.text: Nay, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:

23.text: And those members of the body, which we think to be less honorable, upon these we bestow more abundant honor; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness.

24.text: For our comely parts have no need: but God hath tempered the body together, having given more abundant honor to that part which lacked:

25.text: That there should be no schism in the body; but that the members should have the same care one for another.

26.text: And thus if one member suffers all the members suffer with it; or, if one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.

27.text: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.

28.text: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondly prophets, thirdly teachers, next miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of languages.

29.text: Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all workers of miracles?

30.text: Have all the gifts of healing? do all speak in languages? do all interpret?

31.text: But covet earnestly the best gifts. And yet I show to you a more excellent way.
